description: Single and two storey side to rear extension incorporating under croft; Juliette balcony to first floor rear extension
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The first floor rear extension gives rise to a breach of the 45 degree line when drawn from the nearest
corner of the bedroom window and results in the detriment of residential and visual
amenities of the occupiers of this neighbouring property. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy D3
(D(7) of The London Plan (2021), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development
Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning
Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>

<p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The first floor rear extension, by reason of
its excessive rearward projection and siting in close proximity to No.3 Broadcroft
Avenue, gives rise to an overbearing, visually obtrusive form of development to
the detriment of the residential and visual amenities of the occupiers of this
neighbouring property. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy D3 (D(7) of The London Plan (2021),
Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and
the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>
